Sam got himself something to drink. He set it on the edge of the table. His cat got close to it. Sam told him to get away. The cat knocked over the drink anyway.
A man was looking to adopt a new cat. At the animal shelter, he saw many cats. There was one that caught his eye. This car was blind, but very sweet and gentle. He immediately adopted this cat.

Phil's bank for his checking account transitioned to online-only. At first it seemed like a dream come true. His fees were lower than ever. The phone lines now operated twenty-four hours a day. Phil later wished he could change his account status in-person.

Candice was a high school senior. She thought graduation meant freedom. After graduation Candice moved out of her parents house. She realized bills are expensive. Candice dreams of going back to high school.

Kayla was seven Years old. Her mom had just told her she was going to be a big sister. Kayla was so unhappy and nervous! But then she got to hold her new baby brother. Kayle realized that she loved being a big sister after all!
Bob had a job interview. He wanted to look sharp to impress the interviewer. Bob got a haircut from his barber. He also bought a brand new suit. Bob was confident going into the interview.

Tim got bad grades in school. His parents made the rules in the house more strict. He screamed that the rules were too harsh. Tim eventually got used to the new rules. The new rules actually helped him do better in school.

Amy was no longer friends with Erin and Sara. She even switched seats to be far away from them. Her new table mate Judy knew Erin and Sara from elementary. They were mean girls and no one liked them. Amy was shocked she could have been blind for so long.

Gideon had a tiny cabin in a patch of pine trees in the woods. He went into town one day for supplies. While there, he met a man looking for him. The man claimed to be his long lost brother Ted. Gideon knew it was a scam, and punched the man in the face.
Terrance is craving some food. He hasn't eaten all day long. Terrance chooses to go get a burger. Terrance orders two because he's so hungry. Terrance enjoys his classic hamburgers.
Jane was teaching her daughter. It was basic math. She couldn't figure out how to count. Eventually Jane got too frustrated. She had to stop and take a long break.
Lulu invited her friends to her Berkshire home. Most of the girls loved it. However Erica thought it was not glamorous enough. As a result Erica decided to leave. She went on home.

Maggie decided to make a chocolate cake. She drove to the market to get the ingredients. She saw a friend while at the market. She invited this friend over to have a piece of the cake. The friend accepted, and showed up at Maggie's house later.

Celine couldn't find her diamond ring anywhere. She'd been wearing it last night, she was sure. Celine mentally retraced her steps. The drinking and the best they'd made suddenly came back to her. Celine's stomach flip flopped as she remembered where her ring was.

Max was the family dog. Everyone was saddened to find out he had terminal cancer. The only way to ease the pain was to get another dog immediately. Max and the puppy got along well although Max only had a year to live. Max did so well with the puppy that he lived another six years.

Jared was trying to quit smoking. He was doing well but he started chewing his fingernails. Jared bought a pack of cheap ballpoint pens. He started chewing on those instead of his fingernails. Jared eventually quit smoking and chewing on pen caps.

The teacher was mad at the class for not finishing the homework. He decided to take out a few test packets and hand it to everyone. No one in the class passed the exam. In addition, the teacher entered the exam grades in the grade-book. Everyone was infuriated.

Jen was out for dinner with friends. When she got home she realized she didn't have her phone. Jen messaged a friend online. She got them to call the phone and find it. She left it at the restaurant and picked it up.

Nina demanded the man turn around. She was certain he was her ex-boyfriend. She wanted to yell at him some more about the past. But when the man turned around, it was someone else. Nina felt very embarrassed and walked away after apologizing.
My girlfriend and I were going to the movies. First we had to find where her purse was. We looked all over my apartment. We couldn't find it. Then, my dog came in with the purse in its mouth.
Lucy needed something to wear. She wanted something warm. All of her clothes were in the laundry however. Finally she found an old sweater. When she put it on it still fit.

Jane was a professor teaching piano to students. Her job was tedious and boring. One day her 8AM student didn't show. Jane was grateful for the break and took it as a chance to relax. Jane spent the morning sipping coffee and reading a book.

It was Media Day and Amy's class went to the library. The library had a small computer lab. Half of the class was allowed to visit the computer lab at a time. Amy crossed her fingers and hoped to go in the first group. Amy was sad she wasn't picked to go first.
My parents were livid. They screamed and hit me, and called me names. I was frozen and emotionless. I couldn't take it anymore. They finally told me to just get out.

I used to play tennis all the time with friends. We would try to meet up weekly to play. It was a lot of fun, but the courts were sometimes very windy. So it would add an extra dimension to a difficult game. But we always had fun and it provided good competition.

Nancy had a ball of yarn for a knitting project. Her kitten spotted it and started to play. He rolled it all over the house and tangled it up like a mess. When Nancy came home, she was furious. She cut the string and cleaned it up.

When I was younger I wanted to be White and privileged. I thought White people had the world as their oyster. Then my white friends started dying of skin cancers. I stopped and reevaluated my wants and desires. Now I love the skin I am in.

Wendy went to a garage sale over the weekend. She discovered something that she thought was very valuable. She bought the item for ten dollars. Wendy took the item to a pawnshop to be appraised. The item was worth 100 dollars and Wendy was very excited.

John reads a review of the movie he wants to watch. He approves of the review and as a result goes to the movie theater. To his surprise, he was very bored of the movie. As a result, he left the theater and went home. John decides to be very judgmental of movie reviews from now on.
I met a lady yesterday. She was elderly, very kind, and sweet. She wanted to talk for hours. We sat and chatted about everything. She told me her name was Patience, and I will never forget it.

Tierre and her grandfather were going fishing. She was only four years old and scared. Little did she know, he had a baby fishing pole for her. She was so happy to get the pole, she lost all fear. She didn't catch any fish, but found a sweet baby turtle.

Andy went to the supermarket to buy bread. He did not know where to find the bread. He asked a clerk to direct him to the bread. The clerk said that the bread is in aisle 12. Andy walked over there and pick up some bread.

Josh was so excited for Christmas. He could not wait to know what his parents had bought him. He knew where they stored the presents. Josh decided to sneak a peak one afternoon. When Josh looked at the presents, he was disappointed that none were his.

Tom wanted to eat healthy. He had trouble find healthy food that was also delicious. Tom's friend suggested he try salmon. Tom purchased salmon and cooked it. Tom enjoyed the salmon and thanked his friend.

Ray loved watching television. Countless hours were spent staring at the glowing screen. One day, the television broke down. Bored, Ray picked out a book lying on the shelf. Ray became more interested in books than TV from that day on.

Jim and his friends started skating. Jim had to borrow his friends board and wanted a new one. He asked his parents for a new skateboard. They took him to the local sport store. He looked around and found a board he likes.

Paris is from London and moved to America to be a coach. He played soccer his whole life. He wanted to help kids reach their dreams. He got a great job as a coach. Paris did well and made a lot of money.

Tom was a 16 year old high school student. Toms birthday was coming up and he was excited. His parents got him many presents. He opened each one enthusiastically. He received many great presents and was very grateful.

Alice had a science test the next morning at 11 AM. So she stayed up all night studying. She tried to force herself to stay awake. But when she woke up, it was 2 PM. And Alice regret trying to stay up all night to study.

The band rehearsed their set before the big concert. The concert was cancelled due to rain. The band rescheduled the concert. They practiced the songs even more than before. The fans loved the concert.
Zack has been taking German. He has a test tomorrow. He has been studying all week. He felt well prepared. Zack made an A on his test.

Jake was always bored after coming home from work. He realized he didn't have any hobbies. He searched the internet and found a photography class. Jake became passionate about photography and made many friends. Now Jake is entertained after work.

Ava was walking through the woods one day. She spotted a gorgeous patch of wildflowers. She knelt and began to pick them. Arriving home, she placed them in a large vase. Ava was thrilled with her forest acquisition.
Ashley's neighbors had just moved into the house. Ashley loved to bake. She baked a cake. Ashley brought the cake to the neighbors. The neighbors felt welcomed with Ashley's visit.

Cal's hair was very frizzy. He brushed and brushed but today it just wouldn't lay down. Cal tried some hairspray and even some gel. It was all no use at all. Cal decided he would just wear a hat today.

Josh needed a suit for his interview. Josh decided to go to the outlet mall to get a suit. He found a suit he liked but it was too loose at shoulder. He went to a tailor to have the suit fitted. Josh now had a great suit for his interview.

One Summer morning we decided to go to the Zoo. We got there late and there was a very long line. By the time we got into the Zoo we had missed the Lion Show. That was very upsetting. Thankfully we got to watch the Elephant show right after.
Kelly was given an engagement ring. Kelly wore it to work the next day. Kelly's coworker got jealous. Kelly's coworker stole the ring. Kelly never got the ring back.

Stacey and her boyfriend decided to go to a movie premier. When they saw the movie, they absolutely loved it. To her delight, Stacey saw her favorite celebrities. She immediately ran to get their autograph. When she received it, she was thrilled.

Fred had a huge crush on a girl in his class. But Fred was scared to speak to the girl because he was unpopular. Fred finally got the courage to speak to the girl's friend. The friend told Fred that the girl secretly liked him too. When Fred finally spoke to the girl, they got along great.
Bob ordered chocolate chunk ice cream. The lady prepared his order. He watched in anticipation. His anticipation turned to impatience. He demanded faster ice cream.

Gina was always forgetting a street near her home was closed. Every time she started to drive north she would see the closed sign. By then she was already headed in that direction. She would then need to make a u-turn in the middle of the street. Gina wished they would finish the construction and re-open the street.

Tony was meeting his girlfriend at a bar. He walked in through the door and saw his girlfriend at the counter. A man was hitting on his girlfriend. Tony's girlfriend was obviously annoyed. Tony showed up and told the guy to get away.

The neighborhood kids were having a water balloon fight. Aaron flung a balloon in the direction of Eve. He hadn't meant it to do so, but it accidentally hit her face! Crying, Eve accused Aaron of doing it on purpose. Upset, Aaron vociferously apologized until Eve believed him.

Stephanie felt heartbroken when her boyfriend left her. She was glad to get away to London for a semester abroad. In London, she met a friendly guy named Clive. Clive proposed marriage to Stephanie after they started dating. Now Stephanie felt happy that her old boyfriend left her.
Lara loved shopping. She tried shopping everyday. Today there was a sale. She tried getting her hands on these new shoes. Yet to her dismay they were sold out.
Rose wanted to see New York City. She took a train ride into Manhattan. There, she saw the sights. Then she had famous New York pizza. Rose loved visiting New York!

I got in an accident a couple of months ago. I was turning right on a street downtown. A semi decided to try to turn from the other lane. He sideswiped my car pretty badly. Luckily, his insurance covered all of my costs.

Kelly's mom said she was going to get an Apple. Kelly didn't think her mom was going to get her a phone yet. So she was beyond excited. Her mom came home that night with a bag. Kelly's face fell when she was it was actually a piece of fruit.

Luke loved everything about Star Wars. He was so excited about the upcoming film. Luke camped out to be in line for the pre sale of movie tickets. When he got up to the cashier they told him he was the lucky winner. Luke had won VIP tickets to the private pre screening of the movie.

Margaret decided to try stand up comedy. She was booed off the stage. She asked her friend why they did that. The friend said she just wasn't very funny. Margaret was undeterred and knew you didn't have to be funny.

Janice was playing video games when the phone rang. The caller explained that they were confirming her mom's appointment. Janice didn't write down the information. Her mom forgot, causing her to miss her doctor's appointment. Janice promised her that she would write it down from now on.

Jane came home from work more tired than usual. Just as she began to relax the neighbor pulled up in his car. His music was so loud she could hear it in her house. She waited for him to turn the music off, but he didn't. 20 minutes late Jane had a headache and was more tense than before.
The man told a story. The boy liked it. The boy asked to hear it again. The man refused. The boy tried to read the story by himself.

Mimi and Alice had a favorite hangout spot. They were the first customers of the establishment. They loved it so much they spent most of their birthdays there. One day the building caught fire. Now all they had of their favorite spot were the memories they created

Haley was mad since she failed a test that she studied hard for. She saw an ant-hill outside and kicked it. Several fire ants climbed out of it. They were moving throughout her entire body. She felt several bites.
We all went to the fair yesterday. The kids really enjoyed the rides. They kept going on the same ones over and over. Finally we got them to go eat some food. Then it was right back to the rides.
Tina bought some wing sauce. It was very spicy. It was so spicy she couldn't stand it. Tina had to return it. She nearly had a heartattack.
It had always been Jen's dream to go to France. Finally, she went to the Eiffel Tower. She took so many pictures! It was a truly stunning sight. Jen was in awe of the beautiful monument.

Alec kept waking up with pain in his stomach. He realized that he needed to change his diet. At first it was really hard to change his eating habits. He came up with a reward system. With that in place, he did alright.

My girlfriend and I were hungry one day, so I used Chipotle's app. Not thinking anything of it, I used the saved credit card on file. When I went to pick up the food, the employees stared at me weirdly. One asked me to wait while she called the police. Turns out I had used the credit card my girlfriend reported stolen.

It was Burt's turn to pick an activity at the . He chose to show off his shooting skills. He paid the man at the sharp shooting booth a quarter to play. Burt was able to shoot five bottles off the shelf. He had won a comic book as a prize.

Steph felt lonely living in her apartment by herself. One day, she heard a cat meowing from outside her window. Steph found a kitten alone outside. Steph brought the kitten to the vet and found out it was healthy. Steph adopted the kitten and now doesn't feel lonely anymore.
Sam wanted to learn to golf. He took his dad's clubs. Then he headed to the golf course. He asked for some tips from other golfers. Soon he was playing golf like a pro!

My daughter always used to wear mismatched socks. I decided to keep the socks in my room until I could match them all. I was finally able to fill her dresser with many matched pairs. Everything went well for a few weeks. Then she started wearing mismatched socks again.
Joe took Susan to the movies. It was their first date. He had been asking her out for a long time. She finally decided to give him a chance. He said that they had a good time.

I went with my friend Jane to the park yesterday. While we were at the park we played in a giant sandbox. Suddenly, fire ants came out of the sand and started biting us! It was so scary that we ran home. We will never go to that sandbox again.

Jeremy looked everywhere to find his first job. He applied to many different places, but no one was hiring. He was discouraged, but applied to a Subway near his house. A week later, he had an interview with the general manager. The next day, the manager called to offer him the job!

Today, I decided to put up a Christmas tree. I went to Walmart and picked the best one for the best price. I managed to stuff it into my car and unpack it all by myself. I put up the tree and cut the strings holding the limbs. The entire tree fell over promptly and made a huge mess and I cried.

Anna was having a picnic on the beach. She laid out the chips and snacks on the blanket. Then everyone went for a swim before eating. But when they returned, all of their food was gone. Seagulls had stolen everything!

Tim woke up early and wanted to have breakfast. He grabbed the cereal box and poured some in a bowl. He went to the fridge and poured milk on his cereal. He took a bite of his cereal and spit it out. The milk was spoiled so he ate a granola bar instead.

Mel lived paycheck to paycheck and money was always tight. He paid his monthly bills on time but had very little cash left over. One fateful month, he was forced to take his car to the mechanic's. Mel panicked when he learned the car needed a new transmission. Given Mel's situation, the mechanic agreed to work out a payment plan.

Jen is worried that no one will ask her to the prom. She asks her friends if they no anyone without a date. As the prom draws nearer she starts to lose hope. Finally Tyler asks her to the prom Jen is so relieved to have a prom date.
A record producer wanted to make money. He found some local performers. He put them together. They gave themselves a name. They began to perform together.

James wanted to be a football player. He worked very hard to get good enough to join the team. He went to tryouts and did his very best. After some deliberation, the coach told him he was on the team. Hard work and determination paid off for James.

Yesterday I got a haircut. I told my stylist I wanted to do something bold this time. I told her to surprise me with something fun. She gave me the most adorable and funky pixie cut. I'm in love with my new look!

Today was Ellie's birthday. Her father told her he had a special present for her. He took her into the living room where a puppy was waiting. Ellie was so happy with her birthday present! She had always wanted a dog.

Janice has been unhappy in her marriage for many Year's. Although she once loved her husband, she now finds him boring. Finally she consults a lawyer and files papers for a divorce. The divorce is very painful for both Janis and her husband. However, when the divorce is complete, Janice feels free.
A fire alarm went off inside the school. Stacy and her friends raced out. They were very eager to get out of school. Thankfully the principal announced the school was closing. Stacy cheered.

I decided to eat oatmeal to lose weight and stay healthy. It tasted awful. I added sugar, cinnamon, butter, candy, marshmallows, and chocolate. The new ingredients made it taste amazing. However, I was shocked when I gained 15 pounds.
Tom was walking in his apartment at night. He didn't bother to turn on the lights. He tripped and fell into a mirror. The glass broke and Tom cut himself. It was pretty bad and he bled.

We needed to go to bed. We were so hyped about it being Friday that it was difficult. We laid in bed for hours talking. We discussed what we were going to do over the weekend. We fell asleep happy and looking forward to the future.

My sister in law's son moved to the suburbs. She wants to visit, but hates highway driving. I told her the commuter rail train stops five minutes away. She told me she does not like mass transit. I told her the train was comfortable, to no avail.

David had to cut up two crates of onions for work. He dumped one crate out on the table and sorted them by size. He took the bigger ones and chopped them first. Dave cleaned off his knife and worked on the medium onions. By the time he cut the small onions, David was crying from the onions.

Paul was the head chef at a restaurant. His cooks weren't making the recipes like they were supposed to be. They were just making Paul's recipes as they wished. He wrote down all of his recipes for them. They now make the recipes right.
Bob decided to lose weight. He hold on to be on a diet the whole day. In the evening he wanted to watch some TV. He got very hungry. He ate some unhealthy snacks.

Ty decided to move to Europe. He applied to transfer to his company's Paris office. Ty's request was rejected because he doesn't speak French. Undaunted, Ty applied again to transfer to London. Ty's second application was approved, and he moves next week.

I went to Chicago on vacation. I was really excited to try some delicious pizza there. On the first day of the trip, I went to a famous pizza restaurant. The pizza was the best pizza I had ever eaten anywhere. Every day on my vacation I ate at the same pizza place.

My grandpa smoked since he was thirteen. When he was seventy two he developed throat cancer. He fought very hard and for a long time to beat it. It was the scariest time in my life. He passed away three years ago and I miss him so much.

Jon loved camping when he was kid. So he decided during the week end he would take his kids camping. The weekend arrived and he took his kids camping. They loved camping. Jon was happy that they also enjoyed camping.

Ricky was playing with his cat. This cat accidentally clawed his arm. His arm started swelling up. Ricky went to the doctor to get it checked out. His doctor prescribed Ricky antibiotics to prevent infection.

Fanny had noticed her kids' room looked like a mess. She told them to pick it up. When they didn't listen, she took their electronics. The kids begrudgingly picked up their room. Fanny thanked them for their effort, giving back their stuff.

Anna rented a kayak at the lake. It sounded like a fun experience. But she soon found that it was not very fun at all! Her arms burned from the intense workout. Anna realized kayaking was best left to more muscular people!
Maya loved horses. She wanted to go on a horseback ride. Her mom took her to a range where rides were offered. She and Maya both got to ride on horses. Maya had a wonderful time!
Melissa invited her best friend to the movies. He agreed to go with her. But after work she got call from him. He could not go to the movies. He got some flu.
I recently got a motorcycle. I needed to get insurance. I decided to call a few companies. One company suggested bundling my insurance. Now I save a lot of money and am insured!

James always was a good student, until one fateful report card. It was Senior year in High School, and he began slacking off for fun. He never was the class clown, but he felt the need to do silly things. After reflecting on this, he realized he needs to fix this. He began studying hard and hoped to reverse his scores quickly.

Sam was going camping this weekend. He knew that it was going to rainy heavily. He bought some boots and extra duty wool socks. His new gear kept him warm and dry all weekend. Sam returned his boots after his camping trip.
Bob took his daughter to the ZOO. She was happy to see all the animals. In the primate house a monkey came to say hi to them. The little girl got scared. They run away from there.
Sam decided to walk home from school. He noticed a girl walking home too. Sam decided to say hello. They started talking and became friends. They walked home several more times after that.

Tom wanted to take his girlfriend out to eat. He tried to take her to a fancy dinner. He grew up poor and didn't know what that was, though. Tom took her to what was actually a mid level place. Tom's girlfriend was not impressed.
I bought four used tires for my car. In a week, two of them were bad. I tried filling the holes in the tires. This did not work at all. I decided to bite the bullet and buy all new tires.

The North family took a vacation to the Blue Ridge Mountains. The park rangers warned them to be bear aware. They kept their food locked in their car when they went hiking. When they returned from hiking, they saw food wrappers everywhere. A family of bears was snacking beneath their tattered convertible top.

Vivian was feeling nostalgic during her rare visit to her hometown. She was excited to return to the old grocery store. But she was soon confronted with an ugly reality. All the clerks were incredibly rude! Now she remembered why she left her hometown.
I took my dog for a walk one day. It was very sunny so he got hot. We walked to a nearby fountain. He drank a lot of water from the fountain. We then walked home and he fell asleep on the couch.

Jose has been seeing Ada for two years and they've discussed marriage. Jose decided it was time to propose marriage to Ada. Jose went to the jewelry store and purchased Ada a diamond ring. Jose picked Ada and took her on an outing to the beach. Once there, Jose got on one knee in the sand and proposed to Ada.

Madelyn was going on a blind date. She was supposed to meet Dave at a restaurant. On the way there, Madelyn's car broke down. By the time she got to the restaurant, Dave was gone. Madelyn thought fate was keeping her from finding the right man.

Hamburgers! Sparky the Labrador sniffed the air hungrily. Sneaking under the fence, he crept toward the neighbor's barbeque. He waited until the neighbor walked in his house and then ran. Sparky snatched a hamburger and ran home to devour his treat.

Mose was making a chicken roast in the oven. He had put it in and was reading while he waited. Suddenly he began to smell smoke. He looked up and saw bright orange coming from the stove. Something in the oven was on fire but he put it out.

My big projects never seemed to get anywhere. I would get discouraged at their size and give up. Now I break up big projects into many small goals. But now I fear I may be going too far in the other direction. Finishing one small goal gives me so much satisfaction that I quit.

John was really worried about his political science exam. He stayed up all night for weeks studying as much as he could. When it was the morning of the test he woke up very nervous. On his way to class he quizzed himself in his head even more. After the test was over he was very relieved and relaxed.
My sister in law had only four teeth left. She grew up poor and could not afford dental care. The teeth were bothering her. She had to get them pulled. She has appointments to get dentures.

Two kids rode their bikes slowly down the road. One of the boys started to speed up. The other followed suit. After a while they came to a steep incline. The second boy was going too fast and fell off his bike.
Sam had a test coming up on Friday. Sam did not study during the week. On Thursday night Sam started to study. When Friday came Sam was still not ready for his test. Sam did not do well on his test.

My cat Gregory woke me up this morning meowing. He rubbed his furry head on my face until I woke up. He purred until I got up to fix him his food. I filled his bowl with dry food and he meowed. Gregory ate of all his food and then we played.

Gary was looking through his fridge for snacks. While looking at his food, he noticed everything had small bite marks. After looking through his kitchen, he determined he had mice. Gary called the local exterminator, who went to Gary's house quickly. After the exterminator killed all of the rats, Gary felt peace.

Josh need to make twenty dollars. He needed the money so he could pay back his father. He finally found a job cutting his neighbor's yard. His neighbor gave him only 10 dollars. Josh didn't make enough money that day.

The Mormon people all traveled downtown. They were going to the temple. They loved worshiping there every Sunday. After the temple, they stood outside and took photos. They had a great afternoon together.

Morgan was going for a bike ride on a sunny day. Halfway through, it began to pour down rain. She stopped under a bridge to wait out the rain. Once the rain cleared, she saw a rainbow across the sky. She was sad it had rained, but the beautiful rainbow made up for it.

Gina had a crush on both Jamie and Josh. But they were cool and she wasn't. Gina called her friend Tami and asked her opinion. Tami felt she had a number of options and detailed them all. Gina and Tami talked about the boys all night long.
Jodie's baby had an accident. She spilled grape juice on the floor. Jodie called around for cleaners. She finally found one. They did a really good job!
We went out for a date night last weekend. We had not done that for a long time. My mother babysat the children. We went to a movie. It was nice to spend time together.
Olivia was playing chess with Tim. But she was tired of losing. She played more and more to try to improve. But she didn't get any better. Olivia quit playing chess.

Bill and Jim wanted to feel more in touch with nature. They decided to take a camping trip. They hiked to the top of a small mountain. They fished and built a fire to cook their catch. They both felt rejuvenated when they returned home.
Our cat hid a lot today. My wife was vacuuming the carpet. She came out after the vacuuming. She hid again when our son came over. She will come out, eventually.

Jim had to do a class presentation for school. Many days were spent rehearsing. On the day of the presentation, Jim was nervous. He felt self-conscious as he presented in front of everyone. In the end, Jim received a passing mark on the assignment.

Anna wanted a natural birth. But she did not handle pain well, so she doubted herself. Then she read about hypnosis and decided to investigate. She learned more about hypno-birth and decided it was right for her. Thanks to hypnosis, Anna got her drug-free birthing experience!

Jon and his family lived in Mississippi. They were eating dinner one night and heard the tornado siren. They decided to go to their tornado shelter. They were glad they sought safety. The tornado was an E5 and did a large amount of damage.
Jim thought he was a great basketball player. He was always a starter on the team. He challenged one of his friends to a scrimmage. His friend beat him. Jim is not as good as he thought.

We decided to go camping last weekend. We went home after work and got all of our things together. We set out for a mountain that was close to our city. Once we got there, the weather was perfect. A great time was had by all!

Mary always wanted to see a Broadway show. She asked her friend Beth if she wanted to go to New York with her. Beth agreed and they set out on their way. When they arrived in New York, Beth surprised her with tickets. That night she watched every second of the show in complete awe.

Laurie bought a new chair at the furniture store. Laurie wanted to bring her chair home that day. She asked her friend Tom if he would help her get it with his truck. Tom said he could help her tomorrow. Laurie had to wait until the next day to bring her chair home.

Norma loved to drink sweet tea and was buying expensive bottles of it. She finally had to start making it for herself to save money. She remembered her grandmother making it in a jar out in the sun. She got some tea bags, filled a jar up with water and set it outside. After a few hours in the sunshine she was rewarded with delicious tea.
Fatima graduated high school. She decided to go to college. Her grades were not good in high school. She went to a community college and did well. She transferred to a large university.
We found a little puppy wandering through our yard. We took him to the local vet. The puppy had a microchip. The vet called the owner. They were so happy to be reunited!

Jerry was suffering from issues with his back. His doctors had told him that there was nothing they could do for him. Jerry searched for information on the internet. He found one website that offered many tips. After Jerry followed them, he started feeling a lot better.

Steph likes this boy Ryan at school a lot. She is hoping Ryan will ask her to the dance. So far he has not asked her and the dance is only a week away. Steph has always been told that the guy should ask the girl. Steph doesn't care about tradition, she asked Ryan and he said yes!

Celia noticed that the winter sky had turned very gray. Celia looked at the weather application on her phone. She saw that a huge snowstorm was moving into her area in a few hours. Celia went to the store to buy bread, batteries and adult beverages. Celia was snowed in but comfortable for the next three days.
I was watching tv one day. I reached for the remote to adjust the volume. I couldn't find the remote anywhere. I got up and looked around for the remote. I finally found it under my couch.
Amanda was paying the phone bill. She saw a number listed dozens of times. She called it to find out who it was. It was a party planner her husband had hired. She had ruined his surprise!

Tommy went to the baseball game Tuesday. He was excited when his favorite batter was up to hit. The batter hit the ball out of the park and right into Tommy's hands! Tommy was ecstatic. Tommy treasured the baseball for years to come.

JoAnne was at the bus stop on Valentine's Day. She was surprised she didn't get flowers at work. She was wondering if her husband forgot about the holiday. A car pulled up right before the bus came. The driver was her husband with a bouquet of flowers.
It was Tina's first day of school. She was wearing her favorite pink backpack. However to her dismay, Stacey had the same bag. Tina was very upset. She never wanted to wear it again.

Terrence used to laugh at the guys who ran track at his high school. One day, Coach Fuller convinced him to try out for the team. He was surprised to find he really enjoyed running. Terrence became the best runner on the team. He ended up winning State in the 100 meter dash.
Kelley made a speech for her class. Halfway into it she had to stop. The class did not want it. Therefore Kelley decided it was a mistake. Kelley then went home.
The janitor was cleaning the school one night. He kept hearing noises. He didn't understand why. He was the one with access to it at night. He disregarded the noises and went back to his work.

I had gotten a stink bomb from my cousin. My plan was to set it off in math class. When nobody sat in the desk I rigged up I got impatient. I went to talk to my friend as a way to hide breaking the vial. Within ten minutes we had to evacuate the class.

Lou was walking home from school. A person he didn't know tried to have a conversation with him. Lou remembered what his mom said about strangers when he was alone. Lou refused to talk to the stranger. He then went home quickly and safely.

Every year, Nell's mom planted a big garden. At tomato harvest time, Nell had to help pick the ripe ones. Then, Nell had to help can tomatoes. Nell's mom asked her to take the leftover tomatoes to the neighbors. Instead, Nell went outside and smashed every tomato.

Tom ordered some items online. He would wait for them to arrive. Every time a delivery truck drove by he would get really excited. After a while all the letdowns became frustrating. Tom eventually got the right truck, though.

Ike loved eating hot dogs, and he had a big appetite. He decided to enter a hot dog eating contest. In front of the whole town, he ate hot dog after hot dog. But then he was too full to continue. Ike ended up coming in third place in the contest!

Carlton went on a camping trip. He had planned on eating canned beans. He discovered that he had forgotten his can opener. Carlton had learned how to open a can using a rough stone. Despite forgetting his can opener, he was able to enjoy his beans.

Ann bought a mini pine tree at the store. She took it home and cared for it. Soon she planted it in her yard. Every year it grew a little taller. By the time Ann's kids were born, it was three feet tall!

Teresa is flying to Maine to see her sister. Her flight has been delayed three hours. Teresa is upset because this takes time away from seeing her sister. Teresa gets out her laptop and video chats with her sister. Teresa is thankful for technology so she can see her sister.

Christine's daughter's birthday is tomorrow. Christine went to the kitchen and got out all her baking supplies. She added all the ingredients for a cake into a bowl and mixed them. Christine put the mixture in a pan and baked it in the oven. Christine decorated the cake in pink for her daughter.
Dan searched his son's room. He found pornography. He approached his son about the magazines. His son denied owning them. Dan let his son off easy.
Tom was out running. He twisted his foot in a weird way. He got an x-ray but nothing was broken. Tom still felt weird. Eventually they figured out he had a torn ligament.

Cindy always wanted to be cheerleader. She tried out in the sixth grade and didn't make it. She was devastated. Cindy decided to practice everyday to get better. Later that year she tried out again and made the squad!
